trans-unit.source: Management tools for SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Management tools for SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Introduction to management tools for SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Introduction to management tools for SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Management Tools for SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Management Tools for SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: This topic explores and compares tools and options for managing SQL Data Warehouse, so you can pick the right tool for your needs.
trans-unit.target: This topic explores and compares tools and options for managing SQL Data Warehouse, so you can pick the right tool for your needs.

trans-unit.source: Choosing the right tool depends on how many databases you manage, the task, and how often a task is performed.
trans-unit.target: Choosing the right tool depends on how many databases you manage, the task, and how often a task is performed.

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: The [Azure portal][] is a web-based management portal where you can create, update, and delete databases and monitor database resources.
trans-unit.target: The [Azure portal][] is a web-based management portal where you can create, update, and delete databases and monitor database resources.

trans-unit.source: This tool is great is if you're just getting started with Azure, managing a small number of data warehouse databases, or need to quickly do something.
trans-unit.target: This tool is great is if you're just getting started with Azure, managing a small number of data warehouse databases, or need to quickly do something.

trans-unit.source: The portal includes metrics covering the current and historical performance DWU settings, the amount of storage being used, successful and failed SQL connections, and a set of visualizations and data that allow you to understand the queries running on your instance and the details of those queries.
trans-unit.target: The portal includes metrics covering the current and historical performance DWU settings, the amount of storage being used, successful and failed SQL connections, and a set of visualizations and data that allow you to understand the queries running on your instance and the details of those queries.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Data Tools in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Data Tools in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: [SQL Server Data Tools][] (SSDT) in Visual Studio is a client tool that runs on your computer and allows you to connect to, manage, and develop your database in the Cloud.
trans-unit.target: [SQL Server Data Tools][] (SSDT) in Visual Studio is a client tool that runs on your computer and allows you to connect to, manage, and develop your database in the Cloud.

trans-unit.source: If you're an application developer familiar with Visual Studio or other integrated development environments (IDEs), try using SSDT in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you're an application developer familiar with Visual Studio or other integrated development environments (IDEs), try using SSDT in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: SSDT includes the SQL Server Explorer which enables you to visualize, connect, and execute scripts against SQL Data Warehouse databases.
trans-unit.target: SSDT includes the SQL Server Explorer which enables you to visualize, connect, and execute scripts against SQL Data Warehouse databases.

trans-unit.source: To quickly connect to SQL Data Warehouse, you can simply click the **Open in Visual Studio** button in the command bar when viewing the database details in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: To quickly connect to SQL Data Warehouse, you can simply click the **Open in Visual Studio** button in the command bar when viewing the database details in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can download the latest version of [SQL Server Data Tools][] (SSDT) that includes support for SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: You can download the latest version of [SQL Server Data Tools][] (SSDT) that includes support for SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Command-line tools
trans-unit.target: Command-line tools

trans-unit.source: One option is to use PowerShell or sqlcmd command-line tools to manage SQL Data Warehouse and to automate Azure resource deployments.
trans-unit.target: One option is to use PowerShell or sqlcmd command-line tools to manage SQL Data Warehouse and to automate Azure resource deployments.

trans-unit.source: We recommend these tools for managing a large number of logical servers and deploying resource changes in a production environment as the tasks necessary can be scripted and then automated.
trans-unit.target: We recommend these tools for managing a large number of logical servers and deploying resource changes in a production environment as the tasks necessary can be scripted and then automated.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: To start using these tools, head over to the [connection][] topic.
trans-unit.target: To start using these tools, head over to the [connection][] topic.
